### getKeyUnsafe() {#a4430532ccc500bed977b3f3ee9faa0aa}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="ResourceKey llvm::orc::ResourceTracker::getKeyUnsafe () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the key associated with this tracker.

This method should not be used except for debug logging: there is no guarantee that the returned value will remain valid.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00114">114</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.

### withResourceKeyDo() {#ac946e909dda8f139167b7d28956f1e51}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename Func&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>Error llvm::orc::ResourceTracker::withResourceKeyDo (Func &amp;&amp; F)</>}>
Runs the given callback under the session lock, passing in the associated <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a48eb648e96394270c69273c29bfad24e">ResourceKey</a>.

This is the safe way to associate resources with trackers.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h/#l00099">99</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/core-h">Core.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
